member.name: M:Divelements.Util.Registration.DivelementsLicenseProvider.GetSavedLicenseKey(System.ComponentModel.LicenseContext,System.Type)
member.summary: This method is necessary because the default implementation of GetSavedLicenseKey only checks the entry assembly, as long as there is an entry assembly which there nearly always is. So, in the case of failure, this method manally enumerates all loaded managed assemblies (something the default method really should fall back to) and tries to get a key from them. This will result in the key always being found, as long as it's there somewhere.

member.name: M:Divelements.SandRibbon.RibbonManager.GetState
member.summary: Creates a string representation of the state of the ribbon, including any user customization.

remarks.para: This method is designed to be used in conjunction with the SetState method to persist user configuration of the ribbon between application sessions.

member.returns: A string representing ribbon state.

member.name: M:Divelements.SandRibbon.QuickAccessToolBar.AddShortcut(Divelements.SandRibbon.WidgetBase)
member.summary: Adds a shortcut to a ribbon control to the toolbar.
member.param: The ribbon control for which to create a shortcut.
member.returns: An instance of the Shortcut class representing the shortcut.

member.summary: Determines whether a shortcut to a ribbon control can be created.
member.param: The control that will be the target of the shortcut.
member.returns: A boolean value indicating whether a shortcut can be created.

remarks.para: This method does not check if a shortcut to the specified item already exists. To do this, use the ContainsShortcutTo method.

member.returns: An array of items.

member.name: M:Divelements.SandRibbon.ShortcutListener.ShortcutActivated(System.Windows.Forms.Keys)
member.summary: Locates the item associated with a keyboard shortcut and activates it.
member.param: The keys that triggered the shortcut.
member.returns: A value indicating whether the shortcut was processed.

remarks.para: The shortcut will not be processed if a item cannot be found, or if the item or any of its parents is disabled.

member.name: M:Divelements.SandRibbon.ShortcutListener.IsShortcutWithinScope(System.Windows.Forms.Keys)
member.summary: Tests to see if a shortcut is within the scope of the ShortcutListener.
member.param: The keys that triggered the shortcut.
member.returns: A value indicating whether further processing is required.

remarks.para: Keyboard shortcuts are caught on an application-wide basis. This method should return whether or not a shortcut should be passed on to its corresponding item. The default implementation of this method checks to see whether the currently active form is the one that has been assigned to the listener via its OwnerForm property, or one owned by it.

member.name: P:Divelements.SandRibbon.ShortcutListener.OwnerForm
member.summary: The Form that owns the ShortcutListener.

remarks.para: The default implementation of ShortcutListener will not process shortcuts unless this property is assigned and the form passed is or owns the foreground window when a shortcut is triggered.

member.name: P:Divelements.SandRibbon.ShortcutListener.Listening
member.summary: Indicates whether the ShortcutListener is currently listening for shortcuts.
